Check.

For more information please visit the community;

Any questions is welcomed.

I hope you all have a good time.

reviewText:
I originally had a long detailed reviewed typed up. I left for the night and accidentally deleted it this morning, so I'll keep it short.

The game isn't what it used to be. It hasn't aged well, and the large amount of spelling errors, and rather crappy 'quests' don't help that, which also have their own share of rather poor sentences strung together.

Maybe I'm being too critical on the game, but it really just seems like the time for something like it has passed.

If you played Metal Assault in the past or really are interested in another 2D shooter, I guess you could check it out, but don't except to be pleased.

reviewText:
I'm between yes and no recommend this game. It has the same gameplay feeling when AG published this game.

The difference between AG and WP.

AG:
+ Content of the game feature are free
+ Decent item in item shop that help players
+ Give starting player a better tut about the game and direction when they rankup
+ Doesn't need to grind much on crafting or quest item
+ More item selection in the item shop as you rank up
+ Ammo stockpile give ammo faster
- Expensive premium item shop
- Lots of bugs that prevent progress of the game
- High rank player kick low rank player or using low tier equipment out of the game
- Host need better ping
- Cannot start the game unless everyone is ready

WP
+ Player are equal unless afk
- Content of game feature are limited that need to be buy with real money in the premium shop
- Limited item in item shop
- Lots of bugs that prevent progress of the game
- Host need better ping
- Cannot start the game unless everyone is ready
- Ammo stockpile give ammo at a slower
- No new item when you rankup
- Give starting player a decent tut about the game, but the direction when they rankup cut off from the game
- Feel like the game is alpha

reviewText: It seems the community hasn't changed one bit. Just like in ye olden days it's filled with BRs, but this time with an extra touch of Koreans joining the fun with their own tongue. Nobody ever lives near the servers which means great fun if you actually try to shoot them accurately and they take zero damage. If you like being called a lagger noob idiot wtf" all the time then this is the game for you!\n\nThe game itself disregarding the community is pretty OK. You get some varied characters and weapon types to choose from and many different choices for armor and weapons. Don't expect to get what you desire quickly
date: since you have to grind for weapons and armor that are outright better in every way or shell out some cash for the big guns and some paytowin buffs. Unlike the Aeria games version that was shut down long ago this seems up to date with the original foreign version of the game content-wise. Sadly this means a grindy gem buff and pet system has been implemented judging by the menus available for them.\n\nThe main draw of this game for me back in the day is that it can run on the most absolute potato PCs

reviewText: This game was at least... playable back when it was on aeria games. Played the game after it went down on aeria as well all the way till it was called giga slave, got ip banned and went to MA taiwan i believe. Stopped playing a few years ago. Now its just an unbelievable brocken grind. Skill points have been done away with, guns are still pay to win and the inflation in the item market is unreal. You will have to grind 50+ hours to get anything to at least stand a chance against anyone with a item mall weapon. Game is also still buggy as hell for being a almost 5 year old game. Heals now heal you over time and reloading in the ammo bay takes â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ing FOREVER. If you have no one with item mall weapons or gear in your party you can't even beat the final boss in the damn story" mode. Game was fun back when i had garbage emachine and was only thing that could run. Would only recommend this to anyone who was doomed with the same fate or really needs to scratch that metal slug itch."

reviewText:
At this current stage, I can not recommend this game.

The major issue here is the lag, if you're outside of US or have a slow internet speed. 5mbp or lower, the game will break. I have no problem with other M-M-O games, such as GW2, Armoured Warfare, War Thunder etcs, these games work fine. Except Metal Assault.

The game play is still solid, just as it was almost 5 years ago, since Ariea games knocked it down. Unfortunately, due to its nature of pay 2 win". The game is not in top shape. As a free player you'll only get ONE inventory slot and not even a personal storage. Those things cost real money! NPC loves to give you quests and you'll love em because you''ll get free loot & money. But you can't turn the freaking quest in because the quest rewards spams you with grenades
recommended: tokens and junks! YES you need inventory space to complete quests! And the only way to get 'Personal storage licence" is to buy the beinnger package through their website.\n\nIn game economy is screwed
hoursPlayed: inflation is at all time highh... player population is VERY VERY VERY VERY LOW. I once found only 3 games. THREE GAMES lobbies.\nIt is a fun game for those who like Metal slug or who played Metal Assault

reviewText:
EDIT: I decided to change my review and my opinion on the game. It has flaws, but you cannot get this type of awesome gameplay anywhere else, so I HIGHLY suggest any fan of Metal Slug or skill-based 2D shooter games check it out.

This game is a prime example of gameplay trumphs graphics. It's very skill-based. It has a questionable Item Mall (more on that below). But hot dang, is it ever a good time!

The core game breaks down into 3 parts: PvP, Mission, and Coop.

PvP is what the game was built around: the PvP in this game is awesome. The skill ceiling is super high, and I've seen some extremely good players do some phenominal stuff. The community is still very new, but mostly filled with players that have played MetalAssault when Aeria Games owned it, meaning these guys know what they're doing. The community is quite nice though, and if you're fast to learn and willing, they WILL teach you how to get better! You're going to get your butt kicked at first, but with some practice, you will get better for sure.

Mission mode is the storyline" of the game. I say it with quotation marks
date: because the story is very bad and really is just there to have some dialogue talking to the user. This mode is very difficult until you have good gear. However it is quite fun
recommended: and it feels very satisfying to beat a level after trying it many times. When you get to the later maps
hoursPlayed: this mode becomes quite profitable as well
voteText: but at the time of writing
helpfulPercent: very little people have gotten to those maps (the game is new
votesHelpful: and the best gear has not been acquired yet).\n\nCoop is what drives the economy in this game. This is the mode where you make your money
votesTotal: and this is the mode that you MUST play if you're going to want to get anywhere in this game without paying real life dollars.\nIt's basically "zombie mode". There's many variations of maps
votesFunny: but the requirements are always the same: complete 10 rounds and get a bunch of EXP and Credits. If you successfully complete the map
commentsCount: depending on how many players you have at the time
column16: you randomly roll for a chance to win one of 1
column18: or 5 box(es). This mode is also quite fun to play
column19: but it is not for everyone
column20: so if you do not enjoy Coop mode
column21:
you will likely not enjoy this game (more on that below).

ABOUT THE ITEM MALL:
I have been trying to play as a COMPLETELY free-to-play player and now have ~30 hours logged.
Yes
column22: it is completely possible to play for free
column23: BUT you have to enjoy Coop mode.\nAt the time of writing
column24: the Item Mall has some 7-day weapons that make your life 10x easier in Coop and Mission modes (THEY DO NOT BREAK THE BALANCE IN PVP
column25: WHICH IS WHY THIS GAME IS WORTH YOUR TIME!).\nThese 7-day weapons can be bought from other players for Credits! How do you make Credits? You must spam Coop mode for a chance to win a box
column26: then sell whatever you got from the box for profits. Then
column27: once you buy those weapons (specifically the Flamethrower is the best possible purchase)
column28: you can do the harder Coop maps for BETTER LOOT!\nThis is how you get rich
column29: and this is how you get better gear.\n\nI plan to make a free-to-play player guide eventually
column30: once I get better at the game.\nFor now

reviewText:
For everyone who has their doubts about if this game is worth it or not. Just play it, it's 100% free and is totally worth checking out. I played this game back when Aeria Games hosted it and the game was so successful. Sadly they closed it down without reason and most players thought it would never come back to life.

I dumped hours into this game when it was first released. If it was P2W or a bad game. I would've never loved it so much to see it's return.

If you haven't tried this game and are looking for a fun and enjoyful experience. Pick this game up and give it a try.

However given that the game was only revived a month or so ago, don't expect it to be 100% flawless. This game has a long ways to go before it's back to it's prime. Still though, I'd recommend this to anyone.

reviewText:
Metal Assault is a fast pace 2D side scroller shooter game with a Metal Slug vive.

The game is pretty simple and stright forward to learn with 4 different playable character with their own special traits with 5 different weapons (pistol, Rifle, shotgun, sniper, and rocket launcher) to use at your disposal.

If you're a PvE type of players you can play the campaign and Zombie mode solo or or Co-op.

If you're a PvP type of player you can battle against other players or with friends! If you don't have any friends or don't want to play against other players, you can still play PvP solo with Ai's.


Pro's:

+Solo/co-op gameplay

+PvP/PvE

+Zombies

+Player costomization (alot of costumes)

+Can run on a potato


Con's:

-P2p netcoding (Peer to Peer)

-Lag in just about every match

-1024x768 resolution lock

-Did I mention the lag?


Overall its a fun 2D shooter side scroller game once you get pass by the lag.


Edit: will update if anything new.

reviewText:
For New people, welcome.
FOR OLD PEOPLE AERIA GAMES LESGOOO MA IS BACK!
Metal Assault is Metal Slug, but it's not. It has four game modes, tons of maps,
There's co-op vs zombies, co-op mission like metal slug. There's PvP, self explanatory. And A.I mode, basically fight against A.I. I forgot names of the four classes except Carl and Ai..
I'll tell them by class types and what they do. There is Carl, a speed type assault in the frontlines, quickly clearing waves of zombies, and is very versatile and flexible. He uses Speed skills like a jump tumble. There is another class, let's call him Tank. He's also supposed to be in the front lines also, tanking, and demolishing anything in his way. He has a body rush skill that shortly stuns and in that time can be used for getting an advantage. There's the female sniper, forgot the name, it's been a while. She stands in the back lines, sniping, and giving cover to the front lines. She can also assault, and is also very flexible. Then there's Ai. She's different than all the others, she can infiltrate deep inside enemy territory, turning invisible. She has a backstep as for movement. She is also very flexible in all ranges, assault to tactical to support.

Overall, awesome game, but needs other platforms other than windows, like Mac, and servers for the Brazil community etc. this has crazy potential once the developers kick in.

reviewText:
I just want to start off by saying that I love the game.
But With the amount of lag that you'll experience I just cannot reccomend it unless you really want to play Metal Assault.

The lag causes Co-op to lose randomly, people will randomly teleport around the map, and more then 1/2 of the community is over about 150 ping.  Unless you plan to play it with a select group of friends that you know(and they better be well coordinated) or with the NA Discord group ( https://discord.gg/0RLJG3RCYLrdcrvY ) , I would not reccomend playing it.

Also, you have to pay(or grind about 30k-50k per) for hotkeys. They locked the last 3 hotkeys on the keyboard so that they're in the item mall.

reviewText: The game is how i remember it although alot more latency issues.  What they need to do is make it so people with lower alot higher ping do not have the advantage and i would recommend it.  But as it sits with my network speed of 115.35 download speed and 17.08 upload and still lagging to 90% of the players that i connected to within my 5 games, that is not including the 2 pve i connected to. There seems to be an issue with how they handle lag.  Fix that and I will recommend the game.

reviewText:
I played for about 20 minutes.

Something didn't feel right playing this game.
I tried to like it.

Maybe the visuals were too cringey for me
Maybe it lacked soul and spirit
Maybe it felt like I played this as a flash game already
oh and the game is locked in a small resolution?? (1024x720) I have to get up close to my screen to see the details of the game... even then, there's not much to look at

Just a note, I didn't have any hiccups with running it.
If I come back to play this game, I'll update this review.
But as of now, I feel as though this game needs more work before I come back to it

reviewText:
This game is like one one of those games where it isn't beginner-friendly, especially in the PVP department(As far as I could tell.) Now don't get me wrong, it's a good game with a lot of potential, it's just that it's very disheartening to know and see that you're playing your first few games with high-ranking players and I usually don't have a problem with this because it's satasfying to debunk someone that has spent more time/money on than the game than you and it's even more satasfying if you're outright dominating them(Rage and accusations are a bonus.) But it's not the case as those high-ranking players have  Better Gear  than you, effectively putting the balance between Skill and Gear more into Gear's favor. Heck in one of the games I was in, two players were talking to each other and one of them brought up the recent players that joined(Me and some other bloke.) and talked about the new players or low ranks" as they called it and also said that we are easy kills. Now I thought that it was just trash talk until I realized that one of the players that was talking was on my team and most new players don't want their own team talking bad about them.


Now here are some suggestions to help early game players get used to the game before tossing them into the chaos that is being "Everyone is Stronger Than You." Follow them if you wish.

Make it so that you do gain experence for playing against AI bots up until a certain level
date: then maybe it halves up until a certain level as well
recommended: until you reach a set level to where you're not allowed to obtain EXP from bots anymore.\n\nHave it so that at early levels
hoursPlayed: a promotion could give you a useful Item or two
voteText: like a new gun or gear. Something to replace the used gear that they give you.(Used
votesHelpful: cannon fodder?)\n\nHave it so that new players can have a better insight on how the game works
votesTotal:
without wandering around aimlessly.

Have a few rooms be beginner friendly and/or beginner only.(And what I mean by "beginner friendly" is that have it so that you could only use low-tier gear or just the starting gear in said room.)


And before you say "Git gud
commentsCount: scrub.) Note that this game is more focused on what gear you have over overall skill
column16: which means that it's doesn't matter how good you are
column17:
you would most of the time be outplayed by the better equiped.



Note: This review is in a WIP state until I play more of the game
column18: all the while I will be changing the review accordingly and may even change it into something that I could recommend.\n"

reviewText:
Fun, and even with players connecting from all around the globe (Or at least Brazil. Hue.) I've never had an instance where I died and called BS due to lag.   The only real problem is that there's not enough players on the game right now to really get into a game fast. It'll leave you waiting in the game lobby for a room to open up for quite some time and honestly, that's why despite recommending the game, I likely won't be playing it a whole lot.

The only things that a player might call foul on gameplay-wise is the apparent lack of licenses, (The lack of licenses is supposed to be something that'll be fixed and added back in eventually.) some hotkeys being paywalled (You can buy them easily from other players on the trade board with in-game cash. About 4-5 hours will easily earn you enough cash for an unlock.) and flamethrowers being OP in some instances.  Flamethrowers are really easily shut down with a single shotgun blast though.

Gameplay otherwise has been smooth as silk for me, it's just I'm impatient and don't like waiting for awhile to get into a game lobby.  I think I might like the game more than others because of the 2D art style and quasi Metal Slug gameplay, so your mileage may vary, but there's a lot to like here and especially for the price of free.

Give it a try and don't shy away from the PvP side of things.  Nothing's more satisfying than watching a BR with flashy gear and some ridiculously high rank eat a sniper rifle round from a new player's starting gun.  The wall of unreadable curses that will follow afterwards is just beautiful.  Delicious salty tears.

reviewText: Great gameplay, great controls, great graphics! Unfortunately, there\'s so many bugs and problem issues that requires more fixes. As an example, going solo in a Co-Op mode is impossible, especially for new players. The bosses in Co-Op mode have too much health (over 69 bar of health!) and can instant kill players by getting hit directly at the multi-spamming homing missiles.
